title: [Feat]: Automatically mute/unmute in meeting when Teams detects muted/unmuted mic on system side
body:
### Describe the feature

I use system mic mute and really need to update my mute/unmute status in meetings

### Motivation

It would be nice to have conditional feature to be automatically muted/unmuted in meeting when Teams for Linux detects that Teams detected muted/unmuted mic on system side. 
Teams already shows buble about muted mic on system side during meeting, but don't switch mute/unmute status on meeting.

Is possible to detect this event in Teams for Linux and switch this mute/unmute status on meeting?

### Alternatives

Or is alternatively possible create mute/unmute DBUS event listener in Teams for Linux so I mute/unmute from external script?

### Additional context

_No response_
